availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. McBrayer (Anderson County clerk, farmer, and prov govt)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, clerk, farmer, and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. McBrayer. Father of Enfield McBrayer, Harvey S. McBrayer, Jennie A. McBrayer, Lucien B. McBrayer, Elbridge D. McBrayer, and Susie L. McBrayer. Clerk in Anderson County in 1850. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Farmer in Anderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 199B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 405.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, District 1, p. 323A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Anderson County, KY, May 1863, p. 125, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James Alexander ‘J.A.’ McBrayer, Sr” (1828-1908)," Memorial #65882636, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65882636 (accessed October 25, 2019).
